Class Reversi

  • java.lang.Object
    • Reversi

  • public class Reversi
extends java.lang.Object
    Reversi class has the main role of creating the GUI elements which the user sees it also updates the scores , player names etc. The class also allows the creation of diffreent size Reversi boards to play and the ability to save and load txt files of the saved games.
    Version:
    (version 7 29/04/18)
    Author:
    DTK3 Daniel Knight

      • loadGameFile

        public void loadGameFile()
        Load the given text file if its a valid one created via the save game method. This has error handling to deal with malformed, corrupted and potentially dodgy files. The loading also changes the board sized to match that of the one save to the file ensuring both boards are the same size.
        Throws:
        FileIssueException - if the file doesn't contain our check mechanism START OF FILE
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found (possibly could have no name or not there)
        java.io.IOException - if there is an I/O error when reading the file.

      • playAgain

        public static void playAgain()
        Play again will set the Play button back to visible so players can play again.

      • saveGameFile

        public void saveGameFile()
        Save game file create and writes to a new txt file which stores information about the current game in the format given below(all followed by new line): - START OF FILE - Board Size e.g. 8 - START OF BOARD - The current board state including all W and B disk and empty tiles - END OF BOARD - Current Play (e.g. B or W) - Player 1 Name - Player 2 Name - Player 1 Score - Player 2 Score - Current White Disks - Current Black Disks The file is marked as read only once writing has finished this prevents tampering of the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - usually in the form of java.io.IOException: There is not enough space on the disk

      • setBorderColor
